intro: Phyllostegia oahuensis, commonly known as Oahu strobilostegia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small, tubular, and typically violet or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stems. This species is adapted to the dry, rocky habitats of its native environment and is considered a rare and endemic plant.
